p: The timing and decision to intubate patients with COVID-19 should be made on a case-by-case basis. The threshold for intubation may be lower in COVID-19 since use of high-flow nasal oxygen (HFNO) or non-invasive ventilation may potentially increase the risk of transmission to HCW [18]. Disease transmission risk of viral respiratory infections during intubation has been shown to be high [18], [24], and therefore early, controlled intubation may also increase the safety margin of intubation and by allowing adequate preparation time for this high-risk procedure. Airborne precautions should be applied throughout.
